topline_md: A Bronx deli shooting left one dead and four injured, while violence marred the West Indian Day Parade with six shot and one slashed; additionally, a Brooklyn motorcycle crash resulted in one fatality and two injuries, highlighting ongoing public safety concerns in New York City.

emergencies_risks.title: Emergencies & Risks
emergencies_risks.summary_md:
### Emergencies & Risks

Multiple violent incidents in the Bronx and Brooklyn raise concerns about public safety during holiday celebrations.

- Bronx deli shooting leaves 1 dead and 4 wounded; 5 suspects are in custody. [Read](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Six people were shot and one slashed as the West Indian Day Parade concluded. [Read](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- A motorcycle crash in Brooklyn resulted in one fatality and two injuries.
